YURI, numb, still carrying Dmitri's hip flask, makes a call from a payphone. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT - MANHATTAN.  DAY. A darkened bedroom.  AVA is fast asleep in her bed, curled up with NICOLAI. The phone rings.  Half-asleep, Ava reaches for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'll accept the charges. We cut between the two sides of the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ava--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, baby. (glancing to a clock - 3am) You forgotten what time it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.  I, er... (talking about anything other than what's on his mind) How was your audition?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're going in another direction.  The direction of someone who can act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that.  You're good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're biased. Ava grabs her robe - goes to the balcony so as not to disturb Nicolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you?  Is everything okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rough day at the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come home.  We miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soon. (more desperate than he intended) How's Nicki?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asleep in our bed.  It's lonely without you. From a bar down the street comes the sound of gunfire - MOBSTERS firing at other MOBSTERS escaping in a car. Yuri tries to cover the phone but Ava overhears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri, what's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's always a party where you are. More gunfire interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd better go.  I just wanted to call--hear your voice.  Kiss Nicki for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. But Yuri has gone. EXT.  ODESSA HARBOR.  DAY. The freighter slips out of the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Ukraine since 1992, $32 billion worth of arms have been stolen and re-sold.  One of the greatest heists of the 20th Century. EXT.  DOCKSIDE - MONROVIA.  DAY. Crates of munitions are unloaded from the freighter onto waiting trucks under YURI's supervision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The primary market was Africa.  Eleven major conflicts involving 32 countries in the past decade - a gunrunner's wet dream. Yuri sizes up the MILITIAMEN loading the arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My best customer was self-declared president of Liberia, Andre Baptiste.  Even though we'd met before, I was in no hurry to meet him again.  He'd gotten a reputation for routinely hacking off the limbs of those who opposed him.  His seven-year civil war has been described as "a relentless campaign of sadistic, wanton violence unimaginable to those unfamiliar with the details of man's capacity to visit the abyss."  That kind of sums up Andy for me. As the final truck door is secured, a customized Lincoln Continental convertible comes flying around a corner - stereo blaring, deliberately terrorizing the locals on the dock. The car slides to a stop beside Yuri.  It contains ANDRE BAPTISTE JNR., a handsome young man with sunglasses, a mirror for an earring and a facial tattoo.  Also in the car, two BODYGUARDS and a pair of LIBERIAN TEENAGE GIRLS dressed in Dallas Cowboy cheerleader uniforms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Yuri, I am Andre Baptiste Junior.  My father would like to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank him but I have other business.  A busy schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is not optional.  My father is easily offended. Yuri ponders for a moment.  The machete in the Bodyguard's hand makes up his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know?  My schedule just freed up. A bodyguard takes Yuri's suitcase.  Yuri is barely in the car before it screeches away. As the car roars along the highway on the edge of control, we hear Yuri's thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if I thought I was scared of Andre Senior, I knew I was scared of Andre Junior. Like father, like son.  The guava doesn't fall too far from the tree.  He was a heavy- drinker, a womanizer with a penchant for cheerleaders and a lover of fast American automobiles which he drove recklessly and with total impunity around the streets of the capital.  Oh yes, he was also a cannibal.  They say Andre would eat a victim's heart while it was still beating to give him superhuman strength.  I could've told him he'd get the same effect from a pastrami sandwich at Carnegie's Deli. Andre announces his arrival in the main street of Monrovia with a burst of gunfire.  The city, a violent clash of cultures.  Goats and Gucci.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monrovia itself was like being on another planet.  Planet Monrovia.  From the temperature it was obviously a planet close to the sun.  I rarely saw another white man even at my hotel that was soon dubbed the "Little Kremlin".  And I never left town alone.  Outside town, was the edge of hell. I didn't want to even gaze into it. The car pulls up to Monrovia's premier hotel.  A DEAD BODY on the ground attracts no attention whatsoever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your hotel. (proudly) Two stars. A PORTER, carrying Yuri's suitcase, steps over the dead body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you bring me the gun of Rambo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part One, Two or Three?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have only seen Part One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The M60.  You want the attachable grenade launcher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.  And the armor piercing bullets. (revving the car) I will be back to get you in an hour...or two.  It's Liberia. (mischievous smile) We left a welcoming present in your room. Yuri nods, uncertainly. INT.  HOTEL AFRICA - LIBERIA.  DAY. YURI enters the hotel. At the reception desk, two HOTEL PORTERS watch a small, portable TV - CNN coverage of the O.J. Simpson trial - gruesome evidence photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, he nearly cut off her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I get to America, I will not live in Brentwood. The CONCIERGE hands Yuri a key. INT.  HALLWAY / HOTEL ROOM.  DAY. YURI goes to open his hotel room door - hears music from inside, enters. Two stunning LIBERIAN GIRLS sit naked on the bed bopping to Madonna's lILike A Prayer".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the most AIDS infested region of the globe, where one in four is infected, Andre's idea of a joke was to put a young Iman and a young Naomi naked in my bed and no condom within a hundred miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd be happy to make you happy. The two goddesses drape themselves around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, we don't have anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we look like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I have AIDS?  Don't you worry? Gloria's lips gently touch his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worry too much. Faith begins to unbutton his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why worry about something that can kill you in ten years when there are so many things that can kill you today? Gloria's hands go to his belt buckle, start to unfasten it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can we make you happy? With great reluctance Yuri reaches behind him and opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By leaving. EXT.  HOTEL - CORRIDOR.  DAY. FAITH and GLORIA, still buck-naked, are tossed into the hallway, their clothes flung after them, door slammed shut. INT.  BAPTISTE'S PRESIDENTIAL OFFICE - MONROVIA.  DAY. A Glock .45, Heckler & Koch .40 and a Beretta 9mm sitm on the ostentatious mahogany desk in front of President of Liberia, ANDRE BAPTISTE - a few pounds heavier, still wearing the same size uniform.  ANDRE JNR. watches over his shoulder. Andre Baptiste examines each handgun methodically. In front of him, a pensive YURI, taking in his surroundings.  Half a dozen gun-toting ELITE GUARDS keep an idle watch.  Several HOSTESSES tend to a refreshments table.  On a nearby sofa, a LIEUTENANT flirts with one of the hostesses. Baptiste glances over to the Lieutenant, irritated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --that's the Beretta, comes with a 36 cartridge, easy-operating clip-- Baptiste tests the loading mechanism. The Lieutenant on the sofa is still not paying attention. Baptiste casually points the gun at the Lieutenant and shoots him in the head - a large portion of his brain splattering across the fleur-de-lis wallpaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, why did you do that? Baptiste, clearly not used to having his actions questioned, turns the gun on Yuri.  He's next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say? Yuri, staring down the barrel of the Beretta, recovers fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you're going to have to buy it. (grabbing the gun from Baptiste) It's a used gun.  I can't sell a used gun. Baptiste is taken aback.  He suddenly bursts into laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A used gun.  That's a good one. The other Officers laugh uncertainly. The Lieutenant's body is dragged out - leaving a smear of blood across the marble floor. Baptiste, seemingly oblivious to the carnage he's wreaked, resumes talking to Yuri, in a measured way as if he's discussing the sad state of punctuality in contemporary society.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no discipline with the young boys. I try to set an example but it's difficult. I blame the MTV. Yuri nods, disguising his terror. Baptiste, checking his Rolex Oyster, rises from his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me show you something. EXT.  BAPTISTE'S PRESIDENTIAL MANSION.  DAY. The camera tracks along the MILITIA - however only the very tops of their heads are visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had heard of the "Boy Brigades", "Small Boy Units", "Kalashnikov Kids".  The theory was that a bullet coming from a fourteen year old is just as effective as one trom a forty year old. ANDRE BAPTISTE haggles with YURI as he inspects his troops ranging from twelve to fourteen.  Yuri, averts his eyes from the boys, uncomfortable reviewing soldiers a head shorter than he. OLDER SOLDIERS fill the ranks behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't pay your asking price, Yuri.  We are not a rich people and the market is already flooded with your Kalashnikovs.  In some places you can buy one for the price of a chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just look at the unit price.  You forget the ancillary costs.  End user certificates need to be forged and notarized, shell companies set up, insurance purchased, pilots and crews hired.  Not to mention the bribes.  You can't get a nut and bolt out of the Eastern bloc without a bribe.  There's one bribe for the nut. Another for the bolt.  This is an expensive proposition. Andre interrogates Yuri's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pay in timber...or stones. Baptiste produces a handful of uncut diamonds from his pocket.  Yuri's eyes widen at the sight of the very precious stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take the stones.  It's hard to get a tree trunk in my hand luggage. Andre smiles.  He turns to his new Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very professional, Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dismissed! Yuri and Andre watch the troops disperse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're planning a new offensive.  If you delay a week I can get you the armored personnel carriers we talked about.  They would give you a significant strategic advantage. Andre nods, grateful for the free tactical advice - regards Yuri in a new light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say I am the lord of war.  But perhaps it is you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not "lord of war".  It's "warlord".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it my way. Andre smiles again.  They are going to be fast friends. He leaves Yuri alone to examine his uncut diamonds in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diamonds are far less bulky than hundred- dollar bills.  You can get a million dollars into a cigarette box. EXT.  ART GALLERY - MANHATTAN.  DUSK. A GO-BETWEEN emerges from a gallery with a wrapped painting, hands it to YURI, waiting in a limo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the mid-nineties, my wealth had caught up to my lies about my wealth - even surpassed the lies. Yuri pays the Go-Between in cash, places the painting in the trunk. INT.  LIVING ROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI enters the front door, drops his luggage at the door. AVA, talking excitedly on the phone, hangs up, runs to greet him. VITALY, in the background, cocktail in hand, with another dubious- looking GIRLFRIEND, is examining another of Ava's paintings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri, I just got off the phone with the dealer.  I sold my first painting. Yuri and Vitaly greet each other with a nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic.  Who bought it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone important.  They want to remain anonymous. (asking in a way that does not expect an answer) How was your trip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know.  Same old, same old. (quickly changing the subject) Where's Nicki, in bed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  Poor darling.  He tried to stay up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll kiss him goodnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This calls for a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What doesn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My first painting.  I'm officially an artist! He watches Ava showing off more of her paintings to Vitaly and the latest girlfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured I was a patron of the arts and of everything else Ava had tried and failed at after modelling.  Acting, her own cosmetics line.  I didn't sabotage her careers but I can't deny it was convenient for me in maintaining a low profile.  She was a beautiful bird in a gilded cage. INT.  BEDROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI kisses his sleeping son, NICOLAI, now three years old. He places a gift at the end of his bed - an expensive-looking microscope. At the same time he spies an object in Nicolai's toy box - a toy gun. INT.  KITCHEN / LIVING ROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI tosses the toy gun in the trash. VITALY, still in the kitchen, catches him - pretends he didn't see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you, brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, still the resident family fuck-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone has to do it. They watch Ava in the living room sharing a joke with Vitaly's girlfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't talk about it. Vitaly looks askance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many car salesmen talk about their work, how many executives at cigarette companies? And both of their products kill more people every year than mine.  At least mine has a safety switch.  If those guys can leave their work at the office, why can't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, you're good.  You almost had me convinced. (to his girlfriend, knocking back his drink) We're going, baby. LATER Yuri and Ava are alone at the window, overlooking Central Park.  He hands her a fresh glass of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Manet, Monet...and Ava Cordova. Ava grins, goes to drink when she notices two huge diamond earrings laying at the bottom of the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trip went better than expected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri, they're beautiful. (flirtacious grin) But what am I going to wear them with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know just the outfit. They kiss. INT.  BEDROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. CLOSE UP on the diamonds dangling from AVA's ears.  She wears the earrings and nothing else as she and YURI make love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know how much she knew and how much she ignored.  I was a good provider and as far as she was concerned - loyal.  Despite the other women, I always made love to Ava as if she was the only one. INT.  HELICOPTER - MANHATTAN.  MORNING. From an unmarked helicopter, JACK VALENTINE and his INTERPOL AGENTS shadow a Mercedes sedan as it weaves through midtown traffic. INT.  SEDAN.  MORNING. YURI rides in the back seat of the sedan, scouring the world affairs sections of several newspapers. A thought interrupts his homework. He opens the sunroof a crack, spies the helicopter tailing the car. He closes the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take Park. EXT.  PARK AVENUE.  MORNING. The sedan enters the underpass beneath the Helmsley building - for a moment the car hidden from aerial surveillance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is good. The Driver pulls over, never coming to a complete stop before Yuri bails.  Horns blare at the illegal drop-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take them on a tour of the Tri-State. Yuri grabs Ava's painting from the trunk and the sedan pulls back out into daylight minus Yuri - the occupants of the helicopter none the wiser. Yuri hails a taxi. INT.  HELICOPTER - MANHATTAN.  MORNING. VALENTINE observes the sedan cruising through the heart of Yonkers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where in God's name is he going?  Is he lost? INT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  MORNING. With some reverence, YURI props Ava's painting against the wall of his private sanctuary, then goes about his business - shuffling passports, deciding who he will be. EXT.  NEW YORK APARTMENT.  DAY. AVA, dressed in a robe, all smiles, pours herself a cup of coffee. She sips the coffee at the window, glances down. In the courtyard below, INTERPOL AGENTS are picking through the garbage cans under the supervision of AGENT VALENTINE.  Valentine curiously examines the toy gun. The smile is wiped off Ava's face.  She makes brief eye-contact with Valentine before stepping back from the window. Slightly shaken, she picks up the phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vitaly...it's Ava. INT.  COCKPIT - ILYUSHIN-76 CARGO PLANE.  DAY. The cargo hold of an Ilyushin-76 cargo plane.  It's so overflowing with weapons, many are strapped into the passenger seats. Sierra Leone - 1999 YURI (V.O.) I was now the best merchant of death alive.  I didn't own my own plane.  I owned a fleet - running guns into Liberia, Sierra Leone or the Ivory Coast at least once a week. Unfortunately, my friends at Interpol were also starting to find West Africa on the map. Most trips I had phoney paperwork.  If the deadline was tight, I had no paperwork at all. In the cockpit, an American PILOT and CO-PILOT keep an idle watch on their instruments as they fly over the endless plains of Sierra Leone.  YURI sits in the jump-seat, reading the Wall Street Journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Even taking into consideration the pay-off to the parents, a week with a girl in Burkina Faso is cheaper than a night with a girl in Jersey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plus, they're cleaner--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and a lot of them speak better English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personally, I prefer a language barrier-- An unmarked military jet appears through the starboard window.  The voice on the radio is familiar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Charlie, Echo, India.  Descend for landing on heading zero...two...nine. The Pilot picks up the radio, looks to Yuri.  Yuri shakes his head, dialling his satellite phone.  Yuri's call is answered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel Southern, it's Yuri.  Sorry to call you on this number but I've got an Interpol jet and-- The jet outside the window falls back. INT.  A PENTAGON OFFICE.  DAY. A mid-rank office dominated by a computer terminal.  We look over COLONEL SOUTHERN's shoulder.  He is admiring a new medal.  Two other MEN IN SUITS sit opposite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't know you right now.  It's not a good time. Southern hangs up. INT.  COCKPIT - ILYUSHIN-76 CARGO PLANE.  DAY. YURI, hearing the response, explodes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a good time! Suddenly machine gun fire strafes the Ilyushin - bullets tearing through the fuselage, perilously close to Yurirs very combustible cargo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Motherfucker! The jet appears again at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Charlie, Echo, India.  Comply immediately. That was your last warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was the first fucking warning?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rock your wings if you intend to comply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm putting us down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You land and we're all going away!  I don't have paperwork!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in a flying fucking bomb!  They're firing bullets at our bullets!  Forget about going away!  They shoot again, we're going away for good!  I'm putting us down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!  Okay!--Fuck!! The pilot responds on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Charlie Echo India.  Descending on heading zero two nine. The Interpol jet takes the lead towards a small airport.  Yuri surveys the terrain below, getting his head back in the game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the airport.  There.  The highway.  It's our only fucking hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pothole could set us off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't underestimate yourself.  You're the best, Tony. The pilot doesn't buy it but reluctantly changes course anyway. INT.  INTERPOL JET.  DAY. From his own wingseat, VALENTINE observes the Ilyushin's detour, landing on the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't land there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't get far.  I want a truck waiting on the tarmac. EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DAY. A heavily-trafficked highway.  WOMEN carrying water jars on their heads, a thin COW pulling the carcass of a car, VENDORS selling dry meat, CHILDREN playing war games. The pedestrians look up to see the lumbering Ilyushin making its final approach - they scatter. The Ilyushin weaves on landing, hits a bone-jarring pothole. INSIDE THE PLANE - boxes of grenades, bullets and other munitions jump dangerously up and down. Finally, the Ilyushin pulls up safely on the highway, engines shutting down.  YURI's head appears out of the cockpit window. Curious LOCALS, recovered from the shock, are gathering at the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to be okay. The PILOTS are already halfway out of the plane door, grabbing supplies as they go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As far from the evidence as I can. The pilots start running down the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, you idiots!  There's not going to be any evidence!  Stay with the plane! The pilots ignore him - run for their lives. YURI is left alone.  He turns a lever marked, "CARGO BAY". EXT.  CARGO BAY.  DAY. The rear cargo bay opens.  YURI stands beside his incriminating merchandise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourselves.  Be my guest.  No charge. One LOCAL MAN tentatively approaches the cargo bay.  Yuri hands him an AK-47 and a box of shells. More SIERRA LEONESE LOCALS emerge from the side of the road, seemingly out of thin air. Yuri hands out more guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the whole crate. Two men oblige, ferrying the crate away. The other locals become bolder, then brazen. Soon it's a free-far-all.  Men, women and children swarm all over the plane pilfering the arms and anything else that isn't bolted down - also a lot that is. Yuri has to exit the plane to avoid being trampled in the rush. EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DAY. YURI buys a Fanta from a vendor - exchanging it for a box of grenades. He sits on a soda crate for a front row seat at the chaos. Yuri has a calculator out - totalling his losses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a fucking disaster. Yuri sees the pilot seats being stolen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, not those!  You don't touch the plane! (plaintive moan) Not the fucking seats... Glancing up the highway, Yuri sees an approaching cloud of dust - VALENTINE and two truckfuls of heavily-armed Interpol Agents. Too late.  The last of the guns and ammunition are being carted away on the back of a thin cow. Valentine's truck fishtails to a halt beside the stripped plane. Valentine is first off the trucks and into the plane's cargo bay - empty. Other INTERPOL AGENTS fan out - futilely questioning locals. Miraculously the weapons have vanished into the bush. Valentine calls out to the last fleeing local - a BOY with a lifevest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you! The boy stares back, defiantly inflates the life preserver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. The entire cargo has gone.  An errant bullet falls off a shelf in the plane and rolls down the floor - Valentine picks it up. YURI sits innocently on his soda crate. A frustrated African Interpol Agent, MBIZI, wound-up by the chase, rushes Yuri - slams him to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You run from us. (flashing a machete in Yuri's face) Can you run with no legs? Valentine rushes over, pulls Mbizi off Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mbizi.  No, no, no. Valentine drags Mbizi out of Yuri's earshot.  Mbizi still wants a piece of Yuri - Valentine preventing him getting to the gunrunner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me disappear him, Mr.  Valentine.  He is a devil.  Let me disappear him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look where we are.  Who will know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will. Mbizi stops struggling against Valentine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn your back, Mr. Valentine.  I will go to hell to stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (to his Agents) Find the pilots. Mbizi and another Agent reluctantly head off in a truck. Valentine returns to Yuri who is dusting himself off.  Valentine handcuffs Yuri himself, picks up the soda crate and sits Yuri back on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've spent my whole career on the right side of the line.  You're the first man I've encountered who makes me seriously consider crossing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing in Sierra Leone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on safari.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting wildebeests with submachine guns?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you with the park service?  Hunting without a license - is that the charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're trafficking arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trading.  But without evidence who can say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trade or traffic, you make a fortune by keeping the poorest people on the planet killing each other. (hesitates, unsure whether to waste his breath - wastes it anyway) Do you know why I do what I do? Yuri remains handcuffed, sitting on the soda crate - dwarfed by the cargo plane.  Valentine paces beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are more prestigious assignments, you know.  Keeping track of the nuclear arsenals.  You would think it more critical to world security.  It's not.  Nine out of ten war victims today are killed by assault rifles and other small arms - like yours. Those missiles just sit in their silos. Your AK-47 - it's the real weapon of mass destruction. Yuri regards his interrogator curiously.  Despite the sun beating down, he feels obliged to give him his version of the facts of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want people dead, Agent Valentine. I admit, a shooting war is better for business.  But I'd prefer people to fire my guns and miss.  Just as long as they're firing. He regards Valentine with something approaching pity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I realize the unspeakable things that are done with my weapons.  I also understand the unspeakable things that are done with Williams Sonoma carving knives and Wilson baseball bats and they aren't taking those off the market any time soon.  People will always buy guns.  Why not mine? Valentine appears to have no answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I go?  You've got nothing on me-- (unable to resist) --but cuffs. Now Valentine smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am legally permitted to hold you for twenty-four hours without charging you. Yuri looks away, knows where this is going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may ask, why do I bother to do that?  I can assure you, it is not because I enjoy your company.  And you may be surprised to learn that it is not for any vindictive motive.  No. The reason I delay you for every second of the permissible twenty-four hours, is that I am delaying your deadly trade and the deaths of your victims.  I don't think of it as taking a day from you but giving a day to them.  Some innocent man, woman or child somewhere has one more day on this earth because you are not free. Valentine looks to his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you in twenty-three hours and fifty five minutes. Valentine walks away.  Yuri is left to ponder the notion. We see time lapse photography of Yuri waiting out his twenty-four hours, under armed guard on the highway - stretching his legs, eating a suspicious-looking sandwich, going to the bathroom, the sun arcing across the sky - all the while his plane is being cannibalized by the locals.  Finally the time lapse slows back into real time. Valentine returns in a Jeep with Mbizi and other Agents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be pleased to know your colleagues were no more co-operative than you. Valentine opens the back of the Jeep.  Lying in the back, the bodies of the two PILOTS shot and stripped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The locals got to them before we could. Yuri turns away from the sight.  His handcuffs are removed. Returning Yuri's documents, Valentine notices a photo of AVA and NICKI in the wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Handsome family. Valentine and the Agents get back in the truck and drive away. EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DUSK. YURI starts to walk down the deserted highway alone - his cargo plane is now just another carcass in the jungle. A CONVOY of armored personnel carriers barrels past him - the color: U.N. white.  The lead car slams on its brakes, bringing the train to a stop.  A woman pokes her head out of the window - CAPTAIN VIVIAN CARLISLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri!  Yuri Orlov!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know.  Fighting the good fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An aid program?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yes.  In fact, I've just had some transport problems.  You couldn't give me a ride to Monrovia, could you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  Climb in. Yuri steps back into a vehicle with which he is very familiar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're pulling out.  It's too dangerous. It's a shame.  We were really doing some good things. Yuri nods in understanding. INT.  HOTEL AFRICA - YURI'S HOTEL ROOM.  NIGHT. A weary YURI enters his room.  Sitting on the green sofa - bound and gagged, face reduced to pulp, silver hair matted with blood - SIMEON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus!  Simeon! ANDRE JNR., a FLUNKY and his CHEERLEADERS appear from behind the door, laughing at his shocked reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andre!  What in heaven is he doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gift for you. Yuri stares into the old gunrunner's terrified eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got here just in time.  I was afraid he would die before you got a chance to kill him. He offers Yuri a Beretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think informed on you - cost you your plane?  He came to meet my father, hoping to take your place. Yuri spits on Simeon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stupid old fuck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed your man when he tried to kill you. Andre again offers Yuri the Beretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want us to let him go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  No.  I... Andre offers him the gun a third time.  Yuri refuses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you do want him dead.  You just don't want to kill him yourself?  I understand. Andre grabs Yuri and presses the gun into Yuri's palm, clasping his own hand over Yuri's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll do it together.  A bonding experience. Andre forces Yuri's finger onto the trigger as he aims at the terrified Simeon - eyes pleading. Yuri attempts to pull his hand away but Andre is too strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stop if you want - but you do.  Just say the word. Andre stares at Yuri not Simeon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, "stop". Yuri opens his mouth but no word comes.  Andre presses Yuri's finger onto the trigger. The gun goes off.  A splash of blood across the sofa's green upholstery. The gunshot echoes around the room.  Simeon is very dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. Andre smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get you another room with a nicer view. INT.  HOTEL AFRICA - LIBERIA.  DAY. YURI collapses on the bar - gestures to the BARMAN who immediately pours a line of cocaine in full view. YURI hoovers it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I started doing a lot of cocaine in West Africa.  I wasn't medicating myself.  I was simply playing catch-up.  I was constantly dealing with people who are chemically imbalanced without the aid of chemicals. It's just a matter of etiquette.  It's rude to act sane in a room full of lunatics. The Barman nods to a patron at a corner table - a SEASONED FIGHTER - no more than eighteen years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bought you "brown-brown", Mr. Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Brown-brown".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mixture - cocaine and gunpowder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does the gunpowder do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's magic.  They give it to the small boys before battle - they do anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some other time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to try it at least once, Mr. Yuri. The Barman starts chopping another line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's your gunpowder. Sure enough the Barman pours the gunpowder from one of Yuri's 39mm shells into the cocaine. The SEASONED FIGHTER, assault rifle slung over his shoulder, intimidating air, sidles up to Yuri - stares him down.  Yuri has no option, does a line. He washes it down with a swig from a vodka bottle, raises his glass to the fighter. The Barman puts on a Ukrainian folk song.  Yuri picks out one of the PROSTITUTES in the bar, starts dancing. He drunkenly dances with one PROSTITUTE after another - the dance almost violent, the prostitutes flung aside, none lasting more than a few seconds - caught in the arms of the other PATRONS. To Yuri, the bar swims before his eyes. The music stops.  Yuri, wild-eyed, looks at the stunned bar room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going for a walk. EXT.  MONROVIA.  NIGHT. A MONTAGE OF SCENES FROM YURI'S P.O.V. IN HIS ALTERED STATE.  [A MIXTURE OF FORMATS INCLUDING SUPER-8 & VIDEO, SHAKY HANDHELD FOOTAGE, OVER-EXPOSED FOOTAGE, BLACK & WHITE FOOTAGE EDITED OUT-OF- SEQUENCE WITH JUMP CUTS AND FLASH FRAMES] YURI staggers towards the edge of town - still swigging from his bottle. A ROOM WITH A CURVED CEILING ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF MONROVIA YURI, eyes unable to focus, stares at a WOMAN'S FACE in front of him, moving back and forth.  The gyrating stops. Yuri realizes he is lying in the mouth of an enormous cement pipe on his back, a prostitute on top of him.  She gets to her feet, adjusting her dress. Yuri panics, hurriedly zipping himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't fuck you, did I?  Did I fuck you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not what I would call a fuck. The prostitute tosses a couple of bills back to him.  Yuri ignores the money, staggers after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sick? She ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sick?! Yuri staggers to his feet - wanders aimlessly across a field. A DANCE IN DUST SOMEWHERE ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF MONROVIA Two dozen pairs of feet chase each other on a dirt field to cheers from a crowd.  The dust clears, revealing a bundle of cloth and string doubling as a soccer ball.  The game is between two indistinguishable teams of MONROVIAN YOUNGSTERS on a makeshift dirt field, goalposts constructed from tree branches lashed together. YURI wanders onto the field, joins the game without asking.  The players humor him by letting him have the ball. Yuri dribbles up field, takes an enormous swipe at the ball, misses completely, clattering to the ground. The crowd and players laugh.  The game goes on.  Yuri, also laughing but in a far more desperate manner, picks himself up and wanders away. A LIBERIAN BAR CALLED "ZANZI-BAR" YURI throws up at the back of a saloon flimsily constructed from rusted corrugated iron. Rinsing out his mouth with vodka, he is distracted by the sound of two little GIRLS arguing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They will!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They will!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They will!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask the foreigner.  The foreigner will know. The GIRLS approach Yuri - no older than seven, formal white dresses, hands politely behind their backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, will my fingers grow back? One of the girls shows Yuri a healed stump where her hand should be. Yuri runs away. A MODERN SCULPTURE SOMEWHERE IN MONROVIA YURI passes in front of an abstract arrangement of holes that turns out to be a building pock-marked with gunshells. Suddenly a FACE appears in one of the holes - SIMEON.  The gunshot wound in his forehead still evident.  Yuri gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simeon. Simeon turns and walks away - revealing a large exit wound in the back of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simeon!! Yuri pokes his head through the hole but Simeon has vanished.  Yuri turns back to find himself trapped by TWO MEN in flip-flops, shorts, Gap T-shirts and AK-47's. Through Yuri's eyes the two men look like four.  The two/four men go through Yuri's pockets, take his watch, shoes. Yuri is oddly compliant - clumsily helping one of the thieves fasten the watch. One of the men, tired of Yuri's antics, aims his gun at Yuri's head. His colleague stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't.  He's Andre's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck Andre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, fuck Andre. The man fires at Yuri.  The gun jams.  Yuri looks almost disappointed.  The man tries again.  Again the gun jams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  They don't usually do that.  Let me have a look.  Maybe I can fix it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off! The man whips the gun across Yuri's face. A PATH OUTSIDE MONROVIA YURI, face streaked with blood and dirt, wanders aimlessly through the brush outside Monrovia. A HYENA appears on the dirt path in front of him - teeth bared, frenzied eyes. Yuri stares at the wild dog - starts to quietly cry.  Tears roll down his cheeks. The hyena runs away.  Yuri is alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.  MONROVIAN DOCKS.  DAWN. A vacant-eyed YURI sits in the shadow of an enormous stack of arms, unloaded from a freighter. A presidential motorcade appears on the dock.  ANDRE BAPTISTE emerges out of his Mercedes Jeep, gun in his hand.  He strides up to Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri, you fucked up!  I am going to shoot your face off with your own gun. Yuri doesn't flinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad.  Andre's latest double? The man's face falls.  The real ANDRE BAPTISTE emerges from the car with ANDRE JNR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's too eloquent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no heart. Baptiste brandishes a copy of the New York Times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen the news?  They accuse me of rigging elections, but after this in your Florida with your Supreme Court of kangaroos-- CLOSE ON the headline, "U.S. SUPREME COURT REVERSES RECOUNT RULING".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --now the U.S. must shut up forever. Yuri just smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More good news.  That's the last aid shipment.  The war is so bad, the U.N. is pulling out. Andre shrugs.  He regards the inactivity at the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is nothing happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No trucks.  They are trapped on the front lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are trucks.  You just have to get all that food out of them. Yuri gestures down the dock where food is being loaded into trucks marked, "HUMANITARIAN AID" Andre Baptiste and Andre Jnr.  are clearly taken with the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Killing certain humans can be considered humanitarian. (thinly disguised reference to the previous night) Isn't that right, Mr. Yuri? Andre Baptiste hands Yuri his payment - a slim briefcase containing a pouch of uncut diamonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After surviving the last few days I'd started to feel like I was invincible.  But there was a weapon that could hurt me. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. From behind the cover of a sofa NICOLAI shoots at an unseen foe, his finger as the gun. The camera pans around the room to find AVA in an armchair opposite AGENT VALENTINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush, Nicki. (to Valentine) I don't believe you. Valentine is unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you prove any of it?  Where is your evidence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hoping you could help us with that. (opens an old file containing a copy of a newspaper clipping, headlined, "Cordova Disappearance" ) I understand your parents died tragically in
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (noting to the gun in his ribs)

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing Valentine's gun pressed to his throat)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 (never averting his eyes from the screen)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fending them off but with little commitment)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone, trying not to sound too desperate)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Yuri, standing beside his uncanny double)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . (reluctant to give his father bad news)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Salvador. (meeting Avars gaze) That regime has startling similarities to several of the regimes supplied by your husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out. Valentine rises to leave.  Ava holds Nicolai, her mind reeling. INT.  FASHION SHOW - NEW YORK.  NIGHT. Impossibly thin MODELS strut along a transparent lightbox of a runway, flanked by SOCIALITES and PAPARAZZI. Projected on the wall behind them, the words, "FASHION AGAINST HATE - Dress Not To Kill" and various images from the world's warzones. Each outfit is enthusiastically applauded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now, one of the sponsors of tonight's evening, former Miss World, Ava Cordova. AVA appears from behind the wings in a designer gown.  She modestly accepts the applause - gradually becomes aware of a projection on her face. She turns to see the projected image of a CHILD holding an AK-47. When she turns back, tears are rolling down her face. INT.  NEW YORK HOUSE.  NIGHT. Back to us, AVA naked, sits on the end of her bed, clothes laid out beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ava? YURI, still carrying his suitcase, appears in the doorway.  He drops the case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ava, what's wrong?  Where's Nicki?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's with your parents. Yuri senses something very wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why aren't you dressed?  I thought we were going out. He finds a robe from the closet - gently places it around her.  She pulls it off her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wear the clothes.  I can't wear the jewelry.  I can't drive the car.  I can't live in this house.  Everything1s got blood on it. Yuri pulls the robe back onto her shoulders, walks to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be so melodramatic. Ava pulls the robe to her, follows Yuri to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I'm melodramatic.  I'm a failed actress, remember?  We need to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?  We never have before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we do. Yuri notices the Interpol business card on the bedside table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These people - you can't trust them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --I've talked to your parents.  Why do you think they don't want your money?  They know where it comes from.  We all know. Yuri sighs, resigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sell people a means to defend themselves, Ava.  That's all.  I don't hold a gun to any one's head and make them shoot--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Yuri, I see the news.  Sierra Leone--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: don't sell machetes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --What do you think is pointing at the victims when they use those machetes?  I see the pictures.  Yuri, the guns are bigger than the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing illegal about what I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care if it's legal, it's wrong. Ava meets his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can accept the drugs.  I can even accept the other women.  I can't accept this. Yuri looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes no difference if I stop.  Someone will take my place the next day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let them.  We have enough.  You're not that little boy in Odessa anymore, lining up for a loaf of bread--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --It's not about the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? He doesn't answer - perhaps he doesn't have one.  Ava looks out of the window at their expensive view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like all I've done my whole life is be pretty.  All I've done is be born.  I'm not just a failed actress.  I'm also a failed writer, failed artist, failed businesswoman.  I'm not much good as a mother.  Come to think of it, I'm not even that pretty any more.  I've failed at everything, Yuri. (turning back to him) But I won't fail as a human being.  I'm leaving. The words finally register with Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't leave.  I'll stop. (as if trying to convince himself) I'll stop. Ava is skeptical.  He holds her, reassures her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been thinking about it for a while.  A lot, lately. (as if trying to convince himself) I'm making more from the oil and timber anyhow. (further reassurance) I'll stop. She interrogates his eyes for the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will?  You promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (changing the subject a millisecond too fast) Now get dressed.  We'll go out. Ava picks up the dress off the bed. Yuri gazes at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, you're wrong about not being pretty any more. She turns back and smiles. EXT.  FIFTH AVENUE AT CENTRAL PARK EAST.  DAY. A YOUNG INTERPOL AGENT, carrying a tray of coffee, approaches a plain panel van parked outside Yuri's apartment building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the next month I stopped running guns. I went legitimate. The van door opens to reveal VALENTINE and other INTERPOL AGENTS, wearing headsets, monitoring a scanner device.  The agents read porn to keep themselves amused - except Valentine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No wonder Valentine was confused. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DUSK. YURI toys with his old BULLET pendant as he talks on the phone. For once the spreadsheets in front of him deal with oil and timber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God there are still legal ways to exploit developing countries. With the cordless phone to his ear, Yuri wanders to the kitchen.  He tosses the pendant down a trash chute. Back in the den, Yuri punches a calculator as he continues his phone call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the only problem with an honest buck is they're so hard to make.  The margins are too low.  Too many people are doing it. Finally we are privy to the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Impossible.  Two and a quarter?  I can't make a profit at two and a quarter.  Why don't you take my oil and I'll fucking pay you? Yuri hangs up, stares down from his apartment window. Valentine's panel truck drives away. LATER Night has fallen over Central Park - criss-crossed by a necklace of lights.  Yuri continues to stare out of the window. He is perplexed by the sight of a diplomatic motorcade parked in front of his building. Before he can make sense of it, the house phone rings. AVA enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri, the President of Liberia is in the lobby. Yuri, stunned for a millisecond, recovers with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's early. INT.  LOBBY - UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. ANDRE BAPTISTE is admiring his new uniform in a gilt edged mirror. ANDRE JNR. is flirting with two TEENAGE GIRLS - residents of the building.  The perplexed DOORMAN stares at the motorcade outside his door - flashing lights on the police escort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --You should come to Liberia with me tomorrow.  It is beautiful this time of year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liberia.  Is that on Long Island? YURI, ashen-faced, hurriedly exits the elevator into the ornate lobby - strides up to Andre Snr.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuri!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing here, Andre?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here for the peace talks at the U.N.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So at the same time you thought you'd drop in on your arms dealer?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what you still are?  You're a hard man to get hold of all of a sudden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --But now you mention it, we are doing a little shopping while we're here - that is if you open for business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've got to be watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course they blame me.  They always blame me.  They are on a--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --hunt for a witch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Witch-hunt".  But I have been granted diplomatic immunity due to the escalation in hostilities. (conspiratorial) That is why I need you.  They are making life difficult to re-supply.  It will require a man of your unusual ingenuity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help you.  I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand. He shakes Yuri's hand firmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you should know that our present difficulties compel us to be unusually generous. Yuri realizes that Andre has placed a huge uncut diamond in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell, Lord of War.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still haven't brought me the gun of Rambo. Andre Baptiste and his son breeze out of the lobby. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM.  NIGHT. YURI enters, sits in an armchair.  AVA and NICOLAI are cuddled on the sofa - Ava reading him a fairytale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that about the oil or the timber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both.  Everything. Ava smiles, carries on reading. Yuri looks to his hand - we rack focus to the uncut diamond.  Yuri gets up. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT - GARBAGE ROOM.  NIGHT. YURI, still in his suit, stands in a dumpster, searching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At four and a half months a human fetus has a reptile's tail - a remnant of our evolution. Amongst a pile of rotten food he finds his necklace containing the BULLET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can fight a lot of enemies and survive but if you fight your biology you always lose. Yuri places the bullet around his neck. INT.  NEW YORK APARTMENT.  MORNING. AVA is fastening eight-year-old NICOLAI's coat, readying to go out. YURI, half-dressed, appears in the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, not even waiting to say goodbye?  I'm leaving in ten minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Nicki has swim practice. Nicolai kisses his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, big guy. Ava kisses Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personally, I'm glad you're going.  You've been here so long you're starting to get on my nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This oil concession should be wrapped up by Thursday.  I'll be back for the weekend. We'll go somewhere - the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be fun. A thought occurs to Yuri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You trust me, right? Yuri's turn to interrogate her eyes.  Ava smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looked me directly in the eye the way I've looked in the eyes of a thousand customs officials, government bureaucrats and footsoldiers from every law enforcement agency in the world - and she lied without flinching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I trust you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'd learned from the best. Ava gives Yuri a final kiss, hurries Nicolai out the door. INT.  MERCEDES SEDAN.  DAY. From the rear seat of a Mercedes sedan we observe YURI exiting the apartment building and entering a waiting Mercedes sedan of his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him. We reveal AVA and NICOLAI in the car.  Yuri's car pulls away and Ava's car follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going, Mama?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like hide and seek?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. EXT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  DAY. YURI locks his storage locker, observable from the street, and exits the facility carrying a passport and briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can always sense when I'm being tailed.  I know what to look for.  But then I'd never been tailed by the woman I love. Returning to his car, Yuri fails to notice that AVA has witnessed his routine from her own car. Instead of following the car, Ava exits with Nicolai. INT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  DAY. AVA, NICOLAI in tow, approaches Yuri's locker. She tries a combination - fails.  Tries another - fails.  A third - same result.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can put myself in Ava's place.  She might have understood if the combination was the last four digits of my social, my birthdate, even her birthdate but not Nicolai's. Ava looks to Nicolai, tries one more combination, reluctantly. CLOSE ON the numerals on the lock - "10...6..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son's birthday unlocked what the government would later describe as, "a catalogue of carnage". "90".  The lock opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that.  Not that, Yuri. Ava opens the storage room door - at first struck by the exhibition of her paintings inside the locker.  Shaking the image from her head, she turns her attention to the briefcases and other documents. She shuffles through the passports in horror - different photos of Yuri, different names: "George Eagleman", "Georges D'Aigle", etc.  Who is her husband?  Is he any of them? INT.  "THE CRIMEAN" RESTAURANT - DAY. VITALY is back at work in the kitchen of the family restaurant. YURI approaches - Vitaly senses something amiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to see how the other half lives?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss your borscht.  Mom and Dad say you're clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too.  They said you went legitimate - hard to believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because it's not true. Vitaly is hardly surprised. Yuri glances to his parents, ANATOLY and IRINA, at the restaurant counter, folding napkins - observing their two sons. They avert their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only you know.  I'm leaving tonight - on a job.  I want you to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.  I'm thinking of opening my own place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe this trip will help.  It's good money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've given my word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't have to know.  We'll tell them we're going for a little "r" and "r".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you need me all of a sudden?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West Africa's fucked-up. (off Vitaly's look) More than usual.  I can't trust anybody.  I need someone to watch my back. The notion touches Vitaly.  Yuri closes the deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Brothers in arms". Vitaly looks to his PARENTS.  They stare at him until he averts his eyes. Vitaly can't refuse his brother. EXT.  HIGHWAY - SIERRA LEONE.  DAY. A fork in the road.  Two large trucks slog through the bush - take the left fork. Sierra Leone - 2000 YURI, VITALY and ANDRE JNR. are in the cab of the truck, beside the DRIVER. Andre is admiring his new M60 machine gun with attachable grenade launcher - the gun of Rambo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction
